column1: #Text=The polycrystalline La2/3Ca1/3MnO3: Agx and Inx composites with x = 0, 0.1, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4 were synthesized through a solid-state reaction route from stoichiometric amounts of high purity (> 3 N) La2O3, CaCO3, MnO2, Mn2O3, metallic Ag, and In2O3.
#Text=These raw materials were thoroughly mixed and ground in an agate mortar with pestle to obtain starting mixtures for the solid-state reaction.
#Text=The mixed powders were calcined at 1000ºC, 1100ºC and 1200ºC in air for 24 hours each, subsequently pellets were pressed from the powders.
#Text=Finally the pellets were annealed in air for 48 hours at 1300 ºC.
#Text=Then the pellets were annealed in flow of oxygen at 800 ºC for 48 hours, and subsequently cooled slowly to room temperature over a span of 12 hours.
#Text=The structure and phase purity of the samples were checked by powder Xray diffraction with Cu Kα radiation.
#Text=Magnetization measurements were carried out in a commercial magnetometer with the superconducting quantum interference device (MPMSXL; Quantum Design) under applied field of 10 kOe.
#Text=The transport measurements were carried out in a commercial Quantum Design physical property measurement system (QDPPMS–6600) apparatus in the range of 5 to 400 K.
